metadata.title: CVE-2022-28737 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
There's a possible overflow in handle_image() when shim tries to load andexecute crafted EFI executables; The handle_image() function takes intoaccount the SizeOfRawData field from each section to be loaded. An attackercan leverage this to perform out-of-bound writes into memory. Arbitrarycode execution is not discarded in such scenario.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-28737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

shim - 15.7-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: shim package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.7-0ubuntu1').
